column4: just getting it to launch, getting the applet in the toolbar, things like that
well ... I'm not sure where your question is -- you click on the icon, either through the applications menu or whatever -- what else do you want to know?
how do I make that application appear? is there a way to add an applet that has not been recognized by the system?
you just use a 'launcher' in the toolbar, and tell it to launch that program

that's just it, I am also having trouble even getting the program to run. I know it is there, and that it should run, but it is not. Plus, it comes with a gnome-applet. you can find the ubuntu port at http://people.ubuntu.com/~thom/network-manager, and the official site at http://people.redhat.com/dcbw/NetworkManger
I'm not sure what you mean -- when you click on it, it doesn't start?

there is nothing to click on. when I try to run it from commandline, I can't even figure out the syntax to get it working. there are no man pages, and --help isn't helping me. Do you have any more ideas where I could look for help? that's why i was wondering if ayone was actually using it here
you're not making sense -- the network config thing in gnome isn't to be run from the command line -- you run it from the settings menu, or whereever it is in gnome
it is NOT in gnome, even after restarting X. do you have any suggestions on either 1) where to get gnome to find it, 2) where to look for more help, or 3) how to use the application itself.
this is not the built in gnome network config. this is a different application called network manager.

you're confused -- the network config app is a GNOME application -- it's not a command-line application -- if you want to configure the network via command line, use ifconfig -- as far as "how to use it" -- that's a silly question, when it's there, you select the interface you want to configure, and say static, dhcp, or bootp, and then that's it
if this is some 3rd party application -- why are you asking about it in here?
this channel is for ubuntu issues
go look at those links. I am not talking about the network-config which is a gnome app.
because I am trying to get the ubuntu install to work with it
but this is a specific package -- and the package maintainer has a website about it
yeah... that's the link I quoted. it is about 20 lines long. which is why I was hoping to find another ubuntu user who was actually using it.
you still -- in 20 minutes -- have not asked a specific question
how much more specific would you like me to be?
what steps you took that didn't work

alright, I added the source repository, got the package and installed the package, restarted dbus, added it to session, restarted gnome, and I am not finding it. I think tritium might have the answer though
